meanings.definition: A similarity in form or structure between entities.
meanings.sent1: The isomorphism between the two buildings was striking.
meanings.sent2: The isomorphism between the two paintings was evident.
meanings.sent3: The isomorphism between the two clouds made them look like twins.
meanings.sent4: The isomorphism between the two trees created a mirror effect in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The isomorphism between the two puzzles made them almost indistinguishable.

meanings.definition: A one-to-one correspondence between elements of two sets.
meanings.sent1: The isomorphism between the two lists ensured each item had a match.
meanings.sent2: The isomorphism between the two maps linked every city to its counterpart.
meanings.sent3: The isomorphism between the two teams' jerseys caused confusion on the field.
meanings.sent4: The isomorphism between the two clocks synchronized their ticking perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The isomorphism between the two keys meant they could unlock the same door.
